intro: Tandonia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá tandonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands. Its foliage consists of palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Tandonia bogotensis is an important species in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
